inicio.titulo_principal: The best tour in La Fortuna de San Carlos and incredible view of the Arenal Volcano
inicio.parrafo_descriptivo: In Sloth's Territory you can observe 2-toed sloths and 3-toed sloths, as well as a great variety of birds and amphibians
intro.titulo_secundario: Sloth's Territory in La Fortuna de San Carlos
intro.parrafo_descriptivo: Sloth’s Territory is a natural gem of 13 hectares, a private reserve protected & maintained by the Rodriguez Perez Family, a traditional Costa Rican Family. 10 of these hectares are currently on a reforesting process. The remaining 3 are a truly paradise with vibrant flora & fauna and the permanent habitat of many kind of animals such as: two and three toed sloths, opossums, frogs, birds, and more. We certainly are an experience with no artificial ingredients!
intro.testimonial: Visit this paradise surrounded by nature and inhabited by sloths
cards.card_1.parrafo: feel the real connection with nature, we'll see and learn about animals while hiking through the wild
cards.card_2.parrafo: about the biodiversity in our ecosystem and the habitat of our principal attraction, the two and three-toed sloths
cards.card_3.parrafo: to the Arenal Volcano and the incredible nature that inhabits our facilities
services.titulo_secundario_parte_2: Below the details about each of them
service.vista_previa.tour_diurno.parrafo: We offer several daily hikes starting at: 8 am - 10 am - 1 pm and 3 pm.
service.vista_previa.tour_diurno.item_1: The trail is accessible for all ages
service.vista_previa.tour_diurno.item_2: The duration of this activity can be from 1 and a half to 2 hours
service.vista_previa.tour_nocturno.item_: The duration of this activity can be from 1 and a half to 2 hours
service.vista_previa.tour_aves.parrafo: You will be able to observe a wide variety of species from: Hummingbirds, Tanagers, Parrots, Honeycreepers, Cinnamon Woodpeckers, Royal Flycatchers, Nunbirds, ...
service.vista_previa.tour_aves.item_2: The duration of this activity is 2 hours
service.tour_diurno.info.titulo_secundar: Information about the diurnal observation tour
service.tour_diurno.info.parrafo_1: We offer several daily hikes starting at: 8am - 10am - 1pm and 3pm
service.tour_diurno.info.parrafo_2: During the hike, the trail allows you to enjoy a gallery forest with lush vegetation and giant trees as Chilamate and Guácimo Colorado; constituting the habitat of many species like: opossums, two and three toed-sloths and many birds such as toucans, tanagers, Royal Flycatchers and others. But the main attraction is the sloth's observation.
service.tour_diurno.info.parrafo_3: The Rodriguez Family, a traditional Costa Rican family will be your guides, since trying to find sloths require high skills because they use to have an  excellent camouflage that make them imperceptible, for not trained eyes. The trail is accessible for all ages, so this is an activity where the whole family can enjoy it.
service.tour_diurno.info.parrafo_4: The trail is accessible for all ages, so this is an activity where the whole family can enjoy it.
service.tour_diurno.info.parrafo_5: The tour includes a trained guide during the whole hike with professional telescope and fresh seasonal fruits snack at the end.
service.tour_diurno.info.parrafo_6: The duration of this activity can be from 1 and a half to 2 hours and the price is US$28 per person; Children from 6 to 12 y/o US$17 and younger than 5 y/o are free.
service.tour_nocturno.info.parrafo_1: Our night hike starts at 6:00pm, the best time to look for animals with nocturnal behavior.
service.tour_nocturno.info.parrafo_2: During this hike, you will have the chance to see different kind of frogs, kinkajous, snakes, spiders, bats and eventually: two and three-toed sloths (but it is not the focus of this specific hike).
service.tour_nocturno.info.parrafo_3: While the night starts and the sky gets full of stars, our well-trained guide will keep you safe while you continue the hike through our property.
service.tour_nocturno.info.parrafo_4: The trail is accessible for all ages, so this is an activity where the whole family can enjoy it.
service.tour_nocturno.info.parrafo_5: The duration of this activity is 1 and a half to 2 hours. The price is US$60 per person; children from 6 to 12 years US$35.
service.tour_nocturno.info.parrafo_6: The tour includes a trained guide during the whole hike, flashlight and fresh seasonal fruits at the end.
service.tour_aves.info.parrafo_1: Thinking about all birdwatching lovers, we have created this exclusive and entertaining activity.
service.tour_aves.info.parrafo_2: The tour starts at 5:00am and one of our professional guides will take you through out beautiful trails to observe a wide variety of species from: Hummingbirds, Tanagers, Parrots, Honeycreepers, Cinnamon Woodpeckers, Royal Flycatchers, Nunbirds.
service.tour_aves.info.parrafo_3: Even when we are focused on the birds, the wide-array of exotic species, in our trails, you will have the opportunity to observe some sloths, frogs and other species.
service.tour_aves.info.parrafo_4: The tour includes a trained guide during the whole hike with professional telescope, binoculars and fresh seasonal fruits snack & coffee, at the end.
service.tour_aves.info.parrafo_5: The duration of this activity is 2 hours.
service.tour_aves.info.parrafo_6: The price is US$60 per person.
details.titulo_principal: The Sloth is officially one of our National Symbols in
details.item_1.titulo: The 16th national symbol of Costa Rica
details.item_1.parrafo: On Wednesday June 30, 2021, the sloth was declared a national symbol of Costa Rica.
details.item_2.titulo: Why is it declared a national symbol?
details.item_2.parrafo:
The main reason to declare this animal as National Symbol is to protect its natural habitat and watch over its population.
Sloth's Territorry, as a private natural reserve is committed to protect and extend the habitat of this beautiful animal and I order to accomplish this goal, we are currently reforesting 10 hectares. 
Your visit and the interest in this creature, it help us to extend this conservation project
galeria.titulo_secundario: In this section you can see images of the different species in Sloth's Territory
